item.title: Mac add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "The Harmonica is the world’s best-selling musical instrument. You’re welcome." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Mac add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Mac add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Mac add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Fear is inevitable, I have to accept that, but I cannot allow it to paralyze me." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Mac add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When each day is the same as the next, it’s because people fail to recognize the good things that happen in their lives every day that the sun rises." -- Paulo Coelho
